reviews.review: O melhor jogo q já joguei até agora. Historia fantastica com uma excelente jogabilidade. Obrigatorio para qualquer um.
Wow, this is a good game. I highly recommend it. Disturbing in a pleasant way.
Jogo incrível, uma verdadeira obra de arte, recomendo muito =)

I'm a little late in getting round to playing this but what a game it was! If you haven't already played it I suggest you do, this is a game that actually deserves the hype it received and will probably be talked about for years to come as a benchmark in storytelling. 

Personally I think it is every bit the equal to the original Bioshock (and I loved the original) and in some ways far superior. I made a concerted effort to avoid any spoilers about the story and although you can guess at some of the plot twists there are others that will shock you at the end, and like any good story it leaves a few questions unanswered.

Although Columbia may lack some of the charm and atmosphere of the enclosed underwater world of Rapture it still is a beautifully imagined world and there are times when walking close to an edge gave me a strong feeling of vertigo. 

The gameplay was slick and tight, the shooting mechanics were very solid and each gun felt very different. The vigors (plasmids) provided a decent mix of strategies to suit different play styles. I have heard some people complain about how linear the game is however I never perceived this to be an issue, there was enough freedom in your ability to handle the combat however you wanted to.  The way you would run out of ammo and need to try different guns from time to time kept things fresh.

I would also like to mention the sound in the game, not the voice acting, score or sound effects, which are all excellent, but the background noise that is everywhere.  From the buzz of the crowd in the streets of Columbia to the mechanical sounds of the airship a great deal of effort has been put into creating an extremely immersive audio world

My only gripe about the game is the way some of the vigors are handed to you later in the game. Several of the early vigors you have to earn the hard way and this made the new powers felt like a real achievement. The last 3 vigors are kinda just handed to you on a plate with almost no effort needed from you, this felt really cheap after the work they put you through to get the first few.

Overall 9/10

Захватывающие приключения в удивительном мире Bioshock вряд ли оставят кого либо равнодушным. Захватывающий сюжет, прекрасная атмосфера и замечательные персонажи. (Если вы прошли игру и не полюбили Элизабэт - то у вас нет сердца.) Стоит отметить замечательный саундтрек, который добавляет в игру еще больше атмосферы и делает ваше погружение в мир Bioshock более полным. Моя личная оценка 10\10 GOTY и я думаю это действительно самый главный претендент на игру года. Фанатам антиутопии и стимпанка - обязательна к прохождению. Любителям первой и второй части, настоятельно рекомендовано пройти, прежде чем забрасывать помидорами. Конкретно в механику Bioshock, INFINITE принес совсем мало и может быть вы не совсем довольны местом действия этой части, но я вас уверяю, что творение автора SystemShock,BioShock не разочарует вас.

Что это было вобще?..

First let me explain that I am not like like most gamers and think that every twist in a plot is something that has changed my life for the better. This game is good. I won't take that away from it. It is fun, but gets boring rather quickly. It took me a long time to beat this game because I would play it for 30 minutes at a time and than say screw this and play something more entertaining. It follows the Call Of Duty follow rule which means you basically just follow the arrow. People have talked about how wonderful the story is but to be truthful people overhype it. It is a decent story. Yes there are twist and turns, but it is a story that has been done before. Let me explain before people start getting angry and yelling that no it hasn't. After I beat the game I didn't feel surprised. I really didn't. If you take out all the "twist" than it is a story that has been told before. Not 100% but still somewhat been told before. There is a girl and *spoiler alert* your her father and also you are the bad guy. If you played the game you understand what I'm saying. To me story is everything. Well not everything but it plays a huge role in the game I play. If there is no story than all you have is a bundle of crap put together with no direction. What made the first Bioshock great (not amazing but great) is how original is was. This game has been done before through both movies and other games. Do I recommend this game? Yes. Do I think this game is the second coming of christ? Hell no. Do I think this game could have been a lot better? Yes. Am I disappointed in this game? I am somewhat. The thing is these big companies who make one great title will take the title and dumb it down and make it seem better than what it really it. The same thing happened to Call Of Duty, Medal Of Honor, Mario, Sonic, Assassins Creed, Final Fantasy, etc etc etc. Take any of these big name titles and look back at how the originals and how  unique and fulfilling they were. Now look at the newer ones. Are they really that good or are you just in denial because you love the franchise so much. Yes they added the grappling hook which I've never seen so many people orgasm over, but honestly it wasn't that fun. People talk like this game is the greatest thing ever and it isn't. So in conclusion buy the game. It is worth the play through, but do not think this game is unique because....it isn't.
Лучшая часть серии Bioshock! всем советую! 9 из 10

The first 30 minutes are excellent and the game as a whole is very good. The storyline seems overly complex for the sake of itself and I was left feeling that many questions weren't answered. Play it on hard difficulty, the combat in medium is so easy you'll get bored. The art style is one of the best I've ever seen. Overall it's a very good game and worth whatever you pay for it, but for me it felt like it was crushed under the weight of it's own convoluted storyline.
Stop a man from being baptized before he accepts Jesus Christ as his Lord and Saviour and receives eternal salvation. As far as creations of Satan go, this one gets a 10/10.

One of the best single player games I have ever played. A superlative narrative that explores some deep concepts and a story that will leave you in awe. Combat and gameplay are just as superb and polished, much better than the previous Bioshocks. I recommend playing on a harder difficulty and take the game slow to really appriciate it.

Best game of the year so far? I believe so! This game has so much to offer, and though others claim it was overhyped, i personally think it was underhyped. This game had amazing visuals and stunning level design (also a lot of the enemies concepts are really well thoughtout, like my favourite enemy the fireman). 

Elizabeth's AI is easily the best AI a game has to date. She interacts with just about everything, and not just with words but sometimes a facial expression to show how she feels. 

Guns can be upgraded in so many different ways, and there are tonnes of these clothing pieces to help you with their different properties. With this, playing the game through once doesn't show you everything, and you really need to replay it to experiance all the different customization. 

There are dozens of secrets to find, so you don't have to bore youself with the main mission if you feel its dull (which i wouldn't say it is).

The story is very enticing and very deep. Lots of people are muddled by the ending, but after a little bit of understanding, it is a very good ending. The game has a nice twist at the end, and throughout the game, it helps you understand why that plot twist is. 

Also through the game are voice clips, known as 'voxaphone's', which can help you learn more about Columbia's past. 

There is so much good about this game, and pretty much nothing bad (apart from a mildly clunky gamplay), so i highly recommend picking this game up...NO!...I force you to buy this stunning masterpiece of a game! It is too good to pass up.
un excelente juego shooter con una historia aunque algo compleja es muy pero muy bien echa, uno de los mejores shooter que e probado
As Shakespeare is to Literature Bioshock Infinite is to Video Games. A Masterpiece of Interactive Art and Storytelling.

No it isn't.. plays well and with a lot of different Vigors to expirement with the game manages to stay fresh till the end. Story is a big plus and stays interesting up untill the end. Conclusion: Cool gameplay, Awesome Story definity a must play!

I cant describe this game... It is so wonderful, such a beautiful masterpiece. 
The storytelling, the characters, the music, everything was fitting. I already loved bioshock 1 but infinite topped everything. I think in terms of storytelling there isnt a better shooter out there now. One of the few games I would probably give a second run. There are not many games out there, where I read up the wiki for more information, not about the gameplay but about the world Columbia. It is such a living world, I just want to kow more about the it and the background. Easily, my Game of the year 2013.
Game of The Year 2013
Une merveille vidéoludique. Des histoires comme ça, on en fait plus depuis Half-Life ! Si vous aimez les scénarios un peu tirés par les cheveux et les FPS, ce jeu est à acheter les yeux fermés.

「今まであなたがプレイしたシングルFPSの中で最高のものは？」
という質問をされたら、私はこの「Bioshock Infinite」の名前を挙げるでしょう。
興味を惹く世界観、続きが気になり続けるスピーディなストーリー展開、魅力的なキャラクター、そして何より高品質なシューターアクション。前作Bioshock1&2のカジュアルさはそのままに、より爽快感と緊張感のある戦闘が楽しめます。超能力「ビガー」との組み合わせはもちろん、武器に偏って戦っても面白く、そういったプレイヤーの好みにあわせて尖ったカスタマイズのできる「ギア」が個性を強くしてくれます。一見複雑そうですが、実際のプレイでは順を追って覚えることができるので、システムが分かりやすく工夫してあるのも素晴らしい点です。
ここまで素晴らしいと気になるのはローカライズの品質ですが、完全吹き替えによる完璧な日本語化がされており、街で聞こえる雑談から自動販売機の宣伝文句まで全て日本語で聞くことができます。しかもその声優陣がとても豪華です。それも単に有名な人を並べたのではなく、それぞれがハマリ役と思えるほどの配役です。実力派声優達による熱演でバイオショックの世界に没頭できること間違い無し。
FPSが初めてでもコレはやっとけ、と言える一本です。要求スペック自体はそんなに高くない点もポイントです。
While not perfect, this is certainly one of the better shooters out there; so good I felt as happy as I did when I played Half-Life 2 for the first time.
best
Long but fun. Perhaps the first shooter/RPG hybrid I've played that feels like they got it just right.

Bioshock Infinite is by far the most excellent game of 2013 and it is going to be pretty difficult for other games to knock this one down from that #1 spot.
The character development in this game is simply fascinating and you quickly become attached to these characters and their story. 
Gameplay 10/10 - The gameplay is superb and there is nothing lacking here. The skylines and Shooting work perfectly together, while the usage of vigors also offers a lot of variety
Sound 9.0/10 - The voice acting is great and the many twists and turns in the sound will leave you breathless
Story 10/10 - BioShock Infinite's story is simply mind-blowing. Once you reach the end and what an end this is, you'll be asking yourself: What just happened? 
Variety - 8.0/10 - Sadly, once you're done with the 8hr Campaign, there is nothing else to do until the DLC's come out, however the Campaign is so worth another go
Verdict: -  9.2/10 - Bioshock Infinite so far is my favorite game of 2013 and without a doubt my favorite story from every videogame I've ever played. This is definitely worth the money.

Easily the most enjoyable First Person Shooter I've ever played. Complete immersion in this game is easy to achieve as you cannot but marvel at the dynamic landscapes and cinematic environments. The world of Bioshock Infinite is alive and you are subconsciously drawn into exploring the side streets and alleys for side quests and cash. 10/10 An Amazing Game.
Yes. Yes. And of course, more yes.
There's always a man, a lighthouse and a city.
2 hours in and I'm thinking to myself....why have I not played this game?!?

There are some games that just keep you watching the screen, even after the end, just as a sign of respect for the team that made the awesome game you just finished.
Yes, it has it's flaws, I said it (FFS, only 2 guns? |:), but it's still a great game, a great addition to the Bioshock series. Just do yourself a favor and play them all, will ya?
L'histoire du jeux est vraiment excellente! Si vous avez jouer au premier Bioshock et n'avais pas necessairement aimer, essayer celui la quand meme. Elizabeth est vraiment tres attachante en plus! :)

It's solid enough - Gameplay is fun and its easy on easy and hard on hard. Despite it being nowhere near worth the three year wait, I'm kinda glad it took so long to come out. It doesn't have many problems aside from its plothole-filled story that prides itself on plotholes, but even that is kinda charming in the deconstruction way the original Bioshock was. At 8 to 12 hours of gameplay it can easily be beaten in a day, but the replay value that it tries to pride itself on is a bit lacking - in your first playthough you'll create a character build that works best for you but quickly becomes mundane after about 5 hours, and trying to play in a different way just seems lame in comparision. I am somewhat awaiting some of the larger DLC because the gameplay is fun enough to make you forget about some of the errors and it's short length does leave you wanting a little more (The last tower defense mission however makes no goddamn sense because the gameplay had been all about progressing up until that point and fighting waves and waves seemed utterly retarded). A solid 8/10, maybe higher for the average person, but while I can applaud the action, I can't recommend the attempting-to-be-cerebral-and-falling-on-its-face writing.
Damn near perfect.

Etwas spät aber: Kolossale Inszinierung. Die Szenen die sich bieten sind einfach grandios.
Die Kämpfe sind zwar hier und da eintönig und teilweise auch lächerlich leicht, aber alleine wegen der Story empfiehlt es sich, das Spiel zu spielen.

So, there's not doubt about how amazing this game is. The BioShock games have always had great stories and an even better way of telling it, and this entry into the series is no exception. Without a doubt the best story we've gotten in a game for a long while, some amazing plot twists here and there. Lovely contrasts as well, when compared to the previous installements in the series, this time we get a city above the clouds compared to Rapture, which was under the sea. It also explains a lot  of the things going on in the background of the previous games giving us a whole new perspective of how the universe of BioShock actually works and what is actually is.

Now, it's not all positive, unfortunately. The gameplay is not the best, sadly. Sure, it's fun to use the different exciting vigors and guns, but it just falls flat and boring after a while. After you use the new powers you unlock throughout the course of the game, they just turn boring way too quickly - and there's not customizing them. The upgrades we get are simply to buff up the damage and/or reduce cost. Some have miscellaneous upgrades such as allowing you to add multiple charges to a vigor instead of having the, for example, default of two.

In the end, the story, environments, details, graphics and everything other than the gameplay, make up for it. Irrational have pretty much nailed every else, just like in BioShock 1. This is, for me, a strong contender to my favourite in the series, BioShock 1. Why not #1? Because the gameplay was more exciting and fresh in BioShock 1, we've already had two games with the same gameplay now - so it's fair to say that I'm personally getting burned out on the "supernatural" aspect of the gameplay.

Rating: 9/10
Astoundingly good. I very rarely complete a game from start to finish, but Bioshock Infinite combined excellent gameplay mechanics with perhaps one of the best stories ever told in a video game.

Consiglio questo gioco a chi ama le abientazioni steampunk condite con una storia terribilmente fantastica migliore perfino del primo capolavoro. 8.5 su 10 direi, solo per via del gameplay riuscito un po (secondo me) monotono (I vigor sono una copia venuta male dei plasmidi, e la limitatezza nelle armi).

A good story, but the game lacks the elements of the first one. I liked it, but at the same time, it was horrible at some parts. Not to say that i don't recommend this game, since i highly do (but play the first game).

While the fun-factor of the gameplay itself takes a backseat to the original (of course), the writing alone makes this game infinitely (seewhatididthere?) enjoyable. Bioshock meets Inception meets The Butterfly Effect.

[Comrade's 2013 Experience of the Year]

After playing the game through its entirety, I was left in awe.

Both this game's setting and story are simply amazing, however the only actual negative was some of the gameplay itself. The environments were great, of course, but the actual weapons felt... weak and enemies became too bullet-spongy later on in the game. Elizabeth is a pretty interesting addition, as she runs around looking for stuff you're running low on in the middle of combat which saved my ass plenty of times. Though interesting she's almost the only actual face-to-face interaction you get beyond a few non-combat areas. And the vigors were... well they were alright but mostly ripped from the previous Bioshock. 

It was the gun-play which was really disappointing. Things like only being able to carry two weapons pretty much forces you to carry a gun and a heavy weapon. Plus weapons have very little kick and the bulletspongy enemies make it feel like you're using a toy gun. At the end of the game ammo is very scarce and there are no vendors you can get ammo from at all. And really, it just felt terrible at points, I found myself wanting to just get combat over with just to get back to the amazing story.

I'd say its definitely worth a buy, as this is easily among the best stories ever told in a game. However in itself, not a good game. So I'd advise you play it on easy to get to the story bits faster.

Story: 10/10 (amazing)

Combat: 3/10 (far too generic and far too much of it shoved in for a story-centric game)

Amazing story that has more complicated twists, well likeable characters (villians included), amazing flowing combat that allows for multiple ways to play, and a lot of theories regarding the concept on religion (the lack of and itself), alternate universes and the strength of choices. You though the original Bioshock couldn’t be topped as a great interactive story telling medium, you thought wrong. Bioshock Infinite acts as its own standalone world, combining the fun aspects of old shooters (health and enemy spamming) with what’s good about newer shooters (limited weapon capacity and some regenerating health).  It also made Elizabeth the right way to make an escort quest. She can’t die, doesn’t fight but provides ammo/health/salts/money/etc, revives when you die and can open tears that can assist in combat. Some say she’s escorting you, but that’s silly. This is how escort quests should be done. This game does so much right that it should be in everyone’s library.

Three words: BUY THIS GAME! If you are a fan of good first person shooters, such as Half Life, then you've probably played Bioshock. Instead of returning to Rapture, this game visits the sky-city of Columbia. You, Booker Dewitt is sent to Columbia to find a young woman named Elizabeth and bring her to New York. Obviously it's not that simple. The story is perhaps the largest draw to Bioshock games, and this entry to the Bioshock series does not disappoint, especially the ending, which will blow your mind. This game will be in the running for Game of the Year, and I would not be surprised if it won.

The game has nothing new to contribute gamplay-wise, but the world created is just amazing and the story is engrossing. My only gripe is that you can only carry two weapons. If you were to play the game, the weapons I would stick with are the volley gun and shotgun.  I would give it an 9/10.

Возможно слишком долго ждал, поэтому забросил пройдя где-то четверть. Спустя пару месяцев решил попробывать пройти заново и НЕ пожалел.  Отличается от предыдущих двух. Более эмоциональная, разнообразная, возможно местами перемудреная, но не сказал бы что это минус. Шикарная графика, взаимодействия главных героев, противники и декорации в лучших традициях биошока. Обязательно попробуйте, даже если не играли в предыдущие части.

A hauntingly beautiful world and an ehtnralling story.  That being said, you could remove "BioShock" from the title and never know the game was in any way related (because it isn't).

Mejor juego de la generación, con diferencias. A diferencia de los dos primeros Bioshock, este tiene una jugabilidad mucho más dinámica, ademas de una historia muy bien lograda y diseño artístico hermoso. No esperes a jugar este juego, porque te pierdes tu vida entera.

Probably, this game is the best of games I played past few years.
Well worth the wait!

Famose Optik, sehr gute Steuerung, tolle Story mit IMHO brillantem Ende. Vom Schwierigkeitsgrad eher gemäßigt bis einfach, daher wenig Stress aber umso mehr Unterhaltung. Negativ: Leider zu kurz. Im Galopp sicherlich unter 10 Stunden zu schaffen, aber bei der Optik nimmt man sich sowieso ein wenig mehr Zeit die Locations zu bestaunen und natürlich nach Goodies zu suchen. Und so kommt man dann auch auf gute 20 Stunden Spielzeit. Nerven tun gelegentlich nur die fixen Savepoints.

One of my very favorite games of all time, stomping both of its predecessors. And I love both, though I much prefer 2 to 1.

Glorious art and world, colors, music, graphics, presentation, story, etc. You name it, this game does it.
Amazing and beautiful game with a great story!!
ESSE JOGO É DEMAIS!!
This is as great as the first Bioshock game! Worth the money, including Season pass! Great story and gameplay!
